intro: Garcinia sumbawaensis, commonly known as Sumbawa garcinia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Indonesian island of Sumbawa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright orange, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed, making it distinct from other Garcinia species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
